_source.plainmarkdown:
**Pro-Trump Republicans Will Rally at Capitol to 'Celebrate Cop Killers,' Says Eric Swalwell**

**Representative Eric Swawell has warned that "Republicans are going to come to the Capitol to celebrate cop killers" over a rally planned for September 18 to seek "justice" for individuals who have been charged in connection to the January 6 Capitol riot.**

**A "Justice for J6" event at the Union Square area of the Capitol grounds has been organized by a nonprofit group led by former Trump campaign operative Matt Braynard to protest charges against January 6 rioters. Braynard has assured authorities that the rally will be peaceful, but D.C. police have expressed fears that it will quickly turn violent.**

**https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/politics/pro-trump-republicans-will-rally-at-capitol-to-celebrate-cop-killers-says-eric-swalwell/ar-AAO6OWl?ocid=msedgntp**

Pro-Trump Republicans Will Rally at Capitol to 'Celebrate Cop Killers,' Says Eric Swalwell

Representative Eric Swawell has warned that "Republicans are going to come to the Capitol to celebrate cop killers" over a rally planned for September 18 to seek "justice" for individuals who have been charged in connection to the January 6 Capitol riot.

A "Justice for J6" event at the Union Square area of the Capitol grounds has been organized by a nonprofit group led by former Trump campaign operative Matt Braynard to protest charges against January 6 rioters. Braynard has assured authorities that the rally will be peaceful, but D.C. police have expressed fears that it will quickly turn violent.

_source.content:
An East Tennessee woman said she refused multiple opportunities to escape Afghanistan in an effort to save military contract dogs left behind during the hasty American withdrawal.

Clinton, Tennessee native Charlotte Maxwell-Jones is the director and founder of Kabul Small Animal Rescue in Kabul, Afghanistan, where she has lived for 11 years.

She said she‚Äôs staying behind until roughly 130 dogs, about 50 of which are military contract dogs, are safely evacuated.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre my responsibility and I love them and I care for them. I think there‚Äôs a less chance of recovering them if I‚Äôm not here,‚Äù said Maxwell-Jones.


Maxwell-Jones told WVLT News that military contract dogs, like working dogs owned by the military, are trained to sniff bombs and perform crucial tasks to help neutralize threats for U.S. troops while overseas. However, she said that military contract dogs aren‚Äôt given the same priority as military dogs.

The main difference between a contract dog and a military dog is who owns it. According to Department of Defense spokesperson Eric Pahon, contract dogs are hired from outside companies to do work for the military, but the military does not own them.

Since the military does not own the contract animals or have access to their health records, they must take charter flights, not military ones, out of the country, Pahon told WVLT News. However, he did confirm that the department has worked with Kabul Small Animal Rescue to move the contract dogs into a safer, fenced in area.

Officials with the Military Working Dog Team Support Association said that they are confident that all military working dogs were evacuated.

Department of Defense Spokesperson Eric Pahon told WVLT News that all military dogs were removed from Afghanistan.

Pentagon Press Secretary John Kirby made a similar statement on Twitter, saying that U.S. military dogs were not left behind at the Kabul airport. He referenced the above photos circulating online and said they showed dogs under the care of the Kabul Small Animal Rescue, not the U.S. military.

‚ÄúTo correct erroneous reports, the U.S, Military did not leave any dogs in cages at Hamid Karzai International Airport, including the reported military working dogs. Photos circulating online were animals under the care of the Kabul Small Animal Rescue, not dogs under our care,‚Äù the post read. https://www.wbrc.com/2021/09/02/east-tennessee-woman-stays-afghanistan-save-military-contract-dogs/

card.description: The Clinton native is working to evacuate military contract dogs left in Afghanistan following the American withdrawal.
card.title: East Tennessee woman stays in Afghanistan to save military contract dogs

_source.content:
First Afghan refugees bound for Camp Atterbury start arriving

EDINBURGH, Ind. (AP) ‚Äî The first group of Afghan refugees bound for Camp Atterbury in southern Indiana arrived in the state Thursday.

A plane carrying the refugees landed Thursday afternoon at Indianapolis International Airport. The refugees were processed and then boarded buses for the drive to the base about 25 miles (40 kilometers) south of the capital.

The refugees were expected to arrive in groups of 1,000 at a time, and about 5,000 are expected in the coming weeks, officials said this week. The refugees include American citizens, Afghan allies who helped in the military effort, and those deemed vulnerable Afghans by the U.S. government.
Gov. Eric Holcomb said Camp Atterbury will house the refugees until they are placed in more permanent housing.

‚ÄúAs Hoosiers, we are proud to do our part and provide a temporary home for Afghan evacuees who have supported this nation,‚Äù Holcomb said Wednesday.

Active duty and National Guard service members at Camp Atterbury will provide housing, medical needs, logistics and transportation.

The refugees are subject to a 14-day quarantine at Camp Atterbury to determine their medical and visa statuses. Non-governmental agencies will aim to resettle them within 10 weeks, Indiana National Guard Adjutant Gen. R. Dale Lyles.

https://www.militarytimes.com/news/your-army/2021/09/03/first-afghan-refugees-bound-for-camp-atterbury-start-arriving/

card.title: First Afghan refugees bound for Camp Atterbury start arriving

(Repeat)ABC ‚Äì Animal Crack-Ups ‚Äì Host Alan Thicke‚Äôs guests are his family from ‚ÄúGrowing Pains‚Äù: Joanna Kerns, Kirk Cameron, Tracey Gold and Jeremy Miller. (Repeat)FOX ‚Äì New Adventures of Beans Baxter ‚ÄìIt‚Äôs too much of a good thing for Beans (Jonathan Baxter) when he‚Äôs asked to shelter a Soviet informant (Shawn Weatherly), and Darla pays him a surprise visit. What were we reading about/watching/listening to this day in 1987.  3 years ago I realized I couldn't relate to current media.  I started watching/listening to media from that day in 1984 and have progressed to the present/1987.  
Follow along if you want as I post movie openings, album releases, concerts & miscellaneous media from this day in 1987 and continue to '88, '89, etc.  Dates are off by one because Leap Year struck this year.

6 PM
NBC ‚Äì Solid Gold ‚Äì Smokey Robinson, Lisa Lisa & Cult Jam, the Jets, Kenny G., Luther Vandross, Melba Moore and Freddie Jackson. Also: an interview with Mary Wilson.

7 PM

ABC ‚Äì Animal Crack-Ups ‚Äì Host Alan Thicke‚Äôs guests are his family from ‚ÄúGrowing Pains‚Äù: Joanna Kerns, Kirk Cameron, Tracey Gold and Jeremy Miller. Highlights include footage of gorilla family life in the mountains of central Africa.

8:00 PM
NBC ‚Äì Golden Girls ‚Äì S2 E24 ‚ÄúTo Catch a Neighbor‚Äù - Two detectives (Joseph Campanella, George Clooney) move in with the girls to stake out their new neighbors, a charming but dangerous couple who deal in stolen gems. (Repeat)
CBS ‚Äì NFL Football ‚Äì Exhibition: The world champion New York Giants at Pittsburgh. (Live)
ABC ‚Äì Movie ‚Äì Grease 2 (1982) spells high jinks and romance with Rydell High School‚Äôs undistinguished Class of ‚Äô61. (Repeat)
FOX ‚Äì Down and Out In Beverly Hills ‚Äì When Barbara (Anita Morris) expresses regret about the turning point in her life, Jerry (Tim Thomerson) encourages her to return to the world of dance.

8:30 PM
NBC ‚Äì Amen ‚Äì S1 E22 ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs Up, Deacon?‚Äù - The Deacon (Sherman Hemsley) turns over a new leaf in his efforts to get nominated for a humanitarian award‚Äîwhich could win him and Thelma (Anna Maria Horsford) a trip to the Holy Land. (Repeat)
FOX ‚Äì Karen‚Äôs Song ‚Äì Karen (Patty Duke) lets Zach (Granville Van Dusen) stay at her place while he recuperates from bypass surgery, then regrets it when he starts trying to run her life.

9:00 PM
NBC ‚Äì Hunter ‚Äì S3 E13 ‚ÄúStraight to the Heart‚Äù ‚Äì A chance meeting with a beautiful woman at a resort is a dream come true for Hunter (Fred Dryer), who‚Äôs on R&R prior to his grand-jury testimony‚Äîagainst the woman‚Äôs boy friend. (Repeat)

_source.content:
As Donald Trump makes noise about 2024, Melania Trump tries to stay out of the public eye

NO MORE TALK OF 2022 OR 2024 ELECTIONS, UNTIL THEY RECTIFY THE VOTE STEALS. ARREST, PROSECUTE, CONVICT AND PUBLICLY EXECUTE ALL TREASONOUS CRIMINALS, ANY INTERFERENCE BOTH FOREIGN AND DOMESTIC WHERE WARRANTED.

Melania Trump, perhaps the most private first lady in modern history, has retreated more and more from the spotlight since departing Washington last January. She has been seen publicly just once this summer, spotted in July by photographers leaving Trump Tower in New York City, accompanied by her son. Other than that, with the exception of a few Instagram posts from random people who happened to glimpse her in the dining room at Trump's Bedminster Golf Club, Trump -- ever the enigma -- hasn't purposefully set foot in front of a camera.

Last month she returned from her summer sojourn in New Jersey to Palm Beach, Florida, where friends say she will reside fulltime at Mar-a-Lago while Barron Trump attends a private high school. She's giving up the Manhattan life she knew pre-White House, a period of time that granted her as much anonymity as possible for being the wife of Donald Trump.

Melania Trump's disinterest in public political life runs deep enough that she has gone so far as to tell several friends that not only does she not intend to bolster her husband's inflated political ambitions, she has zero desire for a White House redux, according to several people who spoke with CNN about her mindset. "Being first lady again is not what she wants," said one of the people, who had a close relationship with Trump during her White House tenure. "For her, it was a chapter -- and it's over, and that's that."

She views her husband's continued impact on the GOP landscape as his job, not hers. "You're not going to see her at rallies or campaign events, even if he 'officially' says he's running again," said another person aware of the disinterest Trump has shown in supporting the former President. "Instead it's going to be Lara (Trump, the wife of Trump's son, Eric) or (Kimberly) Guilfoyle (the girlfriend of Trump's eldest son, Don). They have that same urge Trump has to (run) again; Melania absolutely does not."

https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/politics/as-donald-trump-makes-noise-about-2024-melania-trump-tries-to-stay-out-of-the-public-eye/ar-AAO7y1C?ocid=msedgntp

card.description: As Donald Trump publicly mulls his political future, playing a game of "will he-won't he" in a potential bid for the White House in 2024, all the while flexing influence in primaries for next year's midterms, there is one key person noticeably quiet. Again.
card.title: As Donald Trump makes noise about 2024, Melania Trump tries to stay out of the public eye

_source.plainmarkdown:
**As Donald Trump makes noise about 2024, Melania Trump tries to stay out of the public eye**

**NO MORE TALK OF 2022 OR 2024 ELECTIONS, UNTIL THEY RECTIFY THE VOTE STEALS. ARREST, PROSECUTE, CONVICT AND PUBLICLY EXECUTE ALL TREASONOUS CRIMINALS, ANY INTERFERENCE BOTH FOREIGN AND DOMESTIC WHERE WARRANTED.**

**Melania Trump, perhaps the most private first lady in modern history, has retreated more and more from the spotlight since departing Washington last January. She has been seen publicly just once this summer, spotted in July by photographers leaving Trump Tower in New York City, accompanied by her son. Other than that, with the exception of a few Instagram posts from random people who happened to glimpse her in the dining room at Trump's Bedminster Golf Club, Trump -- ever the enigma -- hasn't purposefully set foot in front of a camera.**

**Last month she returned from her summer sojourn in New Jersey to Palm Beach, Florida, where friends say she will reside fulltime at Mar-a-Lago while Barron Trump attends a private high school. She's giving up the Manhattan life she knew pre-White House, a period of time that granted her as much anonymity as possible for being the wife of Donald Trump.**

**Melania Trump's disinterest in public political life runs deep enough that she has gone so far as to tell several friends that not only does she not intend to bolster her husband's inflated political ambitions, she has zero desire for a White House redux, according to several people who spoke with CNN about her mindset. "Being first lady again is not what she wants," said one of the people, who had a close relationship with Trump during her White House tenure. "For her, it was a chapter -- and it's over, and that's that."**

**She views her husband's continued impact on the GOP landscape as his job, not hers. "You're not going to see her at rallies or campaign events, even if he 'officially' says he's running again," said another person aware of the disinterest Trump has shown in supporting the former President. "Instead it's going to be Lara (Trump, the wife of Trump's son, Eric) or (Kimberly) Guilfoyle (the girlfriend of Trump's eldest son, Don). They have that same urge Trump has to (run) again; Melania absolutely does not."**

**https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/politics/as-donald-trump-makes-noise-about-2024-melania-trump-tries-to-stay-out-of-the-public-eye/ar-AAO7y1C?ocid=msedgntp**

_source.content:
Largest School District In Kansas Will Effectively Expel Students Who Violate Mask Mandate

Students who refuse to wear their mask "properly" four times will be barred from attending class, in person or virtually

National File has obtained an email from English teacher Lizanne Minerva at Northwest High School in Wichita, Kansas, part of USD-259, the state‚Äôs largest school district. The email appears to quote an email from principal Eric Hofer-Holdeman, who declares that students caught violating the district‚Äôs newly-implemented mask mandate four times will be effectively expelled from the school.

In the email, Minerva writes, ‚ÄúI am passing along the expectations for the mask mandate, cut-and-pasting information from Principal Hofer-Holdeman‚Äôs weekly message to teachers.‚Äù In his message, Hofer-Holdeman explains that ‚Äú1st noncompliance‚Äù with the mask mandate will result in a ‚ÄúVerbal warning‚Äù and ‚ÄúIf the student complies with an Administrator request to wear their mask properly, they will be allowed to return to class only if you as the teacher allow it. Administration will assume you do not want the student back in your class during that period unless you specifically write in your communication email that you will allow the student back in that period.‚Äù

The consequences for a lapse in face coverings grow quickly, according to Hofer-Holdeman. ‚Äú2nd noncompliance: Verbal warning with call to parents,‚Äù write Holdeman. Additionally, students will not be allowed to return to their class, regardless of the teacher‚Äôs option. ‚ÄúIf the student refuses to wear their mask properly for the Administrator, then that student will be removed from school until the mask mandate is lifted,‚Äù Hofer-Holderman adds, in italics.

A third ‚Äúnoncompliance‚Äù will result in an ‚ÄúIn-person meeting with admin, student, and student‚Äôs parent(s) or guardian(s)‚Äù and if the student refuses to wear the mask ‚Äúproperly‚Äù in front of the administrator, again, the student will be removed from school.

If the student dares let their mask slip a fourth time, then Hofer-Holderman declares, ‚ÄúStudent may no longer attend in-person until the mask mandate is lifted. Further, their absences will be considered unexcused, learning remotely with NWHS teachers will not be an option. Only those students who are required to quarantine will be allowed to log into Teams and join a class remotely.‚Äù

Additionally, the About page for USD-259 reveals that the district‚Äôs stated mission is, ‚ÄúInspiring future leaders and empowering each student with the 21st century skills and knowledge necessary for success.‚Äù [LOL] National File asked Arensman and USD-259 if removing students from school over a refusal to ‚Äúproperly‚Äù wear a face mask advances this mission and did not receive an immediate response.

https://nationalfile.com/largest-school-district-in-kansas-will-effectively-expel-students-who-violate-mask-mandate/
